sanskrit_verse:
यस्त्वनाक्षारितः पूर्वमभिभाषेत कारणात् ।
न दोषं प्राप्नुयात्किं चिन्न हि तस्य व्यतिक्रमः ॥ ८.३५५॥
transliteration:
yas tv anākṣāritaḥ pūrvam abhibhāṣeta kāraṇāt |
na doṣaṃ prāpnuyāt kiñcin na hi tasya vyatikramaḥ || 8.355||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who speaks without prior instruction, out of personal motive, incurs no fault thereby, for there is no transgression where capacity has not been formally invoked.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from formal invocation, not spontaneous action
Capacity-based responsibility requires explicit alignment with dharma-role
Causation is determined by structural position, not intent alone
Restoration logic begins when misaligned speech is realigned to its source
Consciousness alignment occurs through recognition of one's uninvoked state
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent speaks without prior authorized assignment AND motivation is self-originated THEN no liability is incurred
IF capacity has not been formally conferred THEN actions are non-binding in dharmic law
IF speech originates outside assigned structure THEN it shall be redirected to restoration protocol, not penalty
IF no violation of formal duty exists THEN no punitive consequence applies
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this axiom establishes that only those acting under formal dharma-capacity can incur juridical fault. Spontaneous or unauthorized speech, even if misguided, does not invoke punishment but redirection toward lawful structure.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality locates fault only where formal capacity intersects with violation. Since no such intersection occurred here, there is no basis for punitive response. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) shows absence of lawful transgression. Responsibility remains proportional to structural role. Thus, reality enforces alignment, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Redirect speaker to acknowledge uninvoked status and align with proper channels
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Encourage voluntary reintegration into structured discourse
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Provide access to authorized speaking roles if needed
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Confirm alignment with truth-consciousness over self-motivation
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Fault arises only from misuse of conferred capacity. Consciousness, not punishment, governs all realignment. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
